chapter.title: SQL Queries
chapter.para: In the previous chapter we formed queries based on JPAQL -- which are based on entity and property names and the relationships defined within the entity class structure. In a real application, there is also a need to form queries that go outside the boundaries of the entity class model -- but should still be pushed to the database to perform. JPA provides us an escape hatch to execute raw SQL queries. However, anything returned is not in a managed state.
